newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Pakistan National Refining defers shutdown to April.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan National Refining defers shutdown to April.

text.p: Pakistan's state-owned National Refining Ltd has postponed the scheduled shutdown of its 63,000 barrels-per-day (bpd) refinery to early April from the second week of February, a source with the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources said.
The shutdown will be for 20 days, he said.
The delay was to allow the refinery "to make arrangements with the contractors" for the routine maintenance, he said.
"We are arranging imports to coincide with the shutdown," he said. "The refinery will not be able to delay its shutdown beyond April."
